semantic_title: Principal Diagnosis Selection When Delivery Occurs
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > b. Selection of OB Principal or First-listed Diagnosis > 4) When a delivery occurs

content.full_text: When an obstetric patient is admitted and delivers during that admission, the condition that prompted the admission should be sequenced as the principal diagnosis. If multiple conditions prompted the admission, sequence the one most related to the delivery as the principal diagnosis. A code for any complication of the delivery should be assigned as an additional diagnosis. In cases of cesarean delivery, if the patient was admitted with a condition that resulted in the performance of a cesarean procedure, that condition should be selected as the principal diagnosis. If the reason for the admission was unrelated to the condition resulting in the cesarean delivery, the condition related to the reason for the admission should be selected as the principal diagnosis. (Evidence: pg no: 65, L63-L67)

detailed_rules.explanation: When delivery occurs during admission, the condition that caused the admission should be the principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 65, L64-L65)

detailed_rules.rule_text: With multiple admission conditions, choose most delivery-related (Evidence: pg no: 65, L65-L66)
detailed_rules.explanation: When multiple conditions prompted admission, select the one most related to the delivery as principal (Evidence: pg no: 65, L65-L66)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Delivery complications as additional diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 65, L66)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any complications that occur during the delivery should be coded as additional diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 65, L66)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Cesarean indication as principal diagnosis when related to admission (Evidence: pg no: 65, L66-L67)
detailed_rules.explanation: For cesarean delivery, if admission condition resulted in cesarean, that condition is principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 65, L66-L67)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Admission reason as principal when unrelated to cesarean indication (Evidence: pg no: 65, L67)
detailed_rules.explanation: If admission reason was unrelated to cesarean indication, use admission reason as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 65, L67)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify condition(s) that prompted admission
Step 2: If multiple conditions, select most delivery-related
Step 3: For cesarean delivery, determine if admission condition caused cesarean
Step 4: Code delivery complications as additional diagnoses
